airplane: a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings
ant: a small insect typically having a sting and living in a complex social colony
bicycle: a vehicle composed of two wheels held in a frame
book: a set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together along one side and encased between protective covers
car: a road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine
clock: a mechanical or electrical device for measuring time
door: a hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle
eagle: a large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill
egg: an oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo
elephant: a large mammal with a trunk
flower: the seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs
forest: a large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth
galaxy: a system of millions or billions of stars, together with gas and dust
giraffe: a tall African mammal with a long neck
grape: a berry, typically green (classified as white), purple, red, or black, growing in clusters on a grapevine
hat: a shaped covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform
hurricane: a storm with a violent wind
ice: frozen water, a brittle, transparent crystalline solid
internet: a global network connecting millions of computers
island: a piece of land surrounded by water
jacket: an outer garment extending either to the waist or the hips
juice: the liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables
jungle: a dense forest in a tropical region
kangaroo: a large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail
keyboard: a panel of keys for typing
kite: a toy consisting of a light frame with thin material stretched over it, flown in the wind at the end of a long string
lamp: a device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something
lion: a large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides
mirror: a reflective surface, now typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, that reflects a clear image
moon: the natural satellite of the earth
mountain: a large natural elevation of the earth's surface
nebula: a cloud of gas and dust in outer space
nest: a structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young
notebook: a book of blank pages for writing notes
ocean: a vast body of saltwater covering most of the Earth
octopus: a cephalopod mollusk with eight sucker-bearing arms
orange: a large round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind
pen: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink
quasar: a massive and extremely remote celestial object
queen: the female ruler of an independent state
quilt: a warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between layers of fabric and kept in place by lines of stitching
rainbow: an arch of colors formed in the sky
robot: a machine capable of carrying out complex tasks
rose: a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae
satellite: an artificial body placed in orbit around the Earth
star: a fixed luminous point in the night sky which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun
sun: the star around which the earth orbits
table: a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working
telescope: an optical instrument for viewing distant objects
umbrella: a device for protection against the rain
universe: all existing matter and space considered as a whole
vase: a decorative container, typically made of glass or china and used as an ornament or for displaying cut flowers
violin: a string instrument played with a bow
volcano: a mountain with a crater that erupts lava
water: a colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain
wind: the perceptible natural movement of the air
x-ray: a form of electromagnetic radiation that can pass through solid objects, including the body
xenon: a chemical element with symbol Xe
xylophone: a musical instrument with wooden bars
yacht: a medium-sized boat used for pleasure
yarn: spun thread used for knitting, weaving, or sewing
yogurt: a semi-solid sourish food prepared from milk
zebra: an African wild horse with black-and-white stripes
zoo: an establishment which maintains a collection of wild animals, typically in a park or gardens, for study, conservation, or display to the public
